meanings.definition: To make right; to remove errors from.
meanings.sent1: She is correcting her spelling mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He always double-checks his work to make sure he is correcting any errors.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was correcting the student's test with a red pen.
meanings.sent4: Just like a painter correcting a crooked line, she fixed the mistake effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was correcting the alignment of the car's wheels to ensure smooth driving.

meanings.sent1: He is correcting the angle of the picture frame on the wall.
meanings.sent2: After receiving feedback, she is now correcting her approach to the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef was correcting the seasoning of the soup to make it perfect.
meanings.sent4: Like a conductor correcting the orchestra's timing, he fine-tuned the performance.
meanings.sent5: The tailor was correcting the hem of the dress to ensure a perfect fit.

meanings.sent1: The coach is correcting the players for their lack of teamwork.
meanings.sent2: Parents play a crucial role in correcting their children's behavior.
meanings.sent3: The judge was correcting the defendant for their unlawful actions.
meanings.sent4: Just like a strict teacher correcting homework, she enforced discipline in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor was correcting the employee's mistakes to ensure better performance in the future.
